recipes.title: Taste the world!
recipes.name: Pizza Margherita
instructions: Preheat the oven to the highest temperature.
Roll out the pizza dough into a round shape.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Place slices of fresh mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce.
Add fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle olive oil and sprinkle salt over the pizza.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted.
Slice and serve hot.

recipes.name: Veggie Burger
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
Mayonnaise or sauce of your choice
instructions: In a bowl, mash black beans with a fork.
Add cooked quinoa, bread crumbs, chopped onion, chopped bell pepper, grated carrot, minced garlic, cumin powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Form the mixture into patties.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook the patties for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are crispy and heated through.
Toast the burger buns if desired.
Spread mayonnaise or sauce on the buns.
Place the veggie patties on the buns and top with lettuce, tomato, and other toppings of your choice.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Ratatouille
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add diced eggplant, zucchinis, bell peppers, onion, and minced garlic. Sauté for a few minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Add diced tomatoes, dried thyme, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper. Stir well.
Cover the pan and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are cooked but still hold their shape.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
Serve hot as a main dish or as a side dish with crusty bread or rice.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add diced tofu and cook until it turns golden brown.
Push the tofu to one side of the skillet and add minced garlic to the other side. Sauté until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, lime juice, and red pepper flakes.
Pour the sauce over the tofu and garlic. Stir to coat the tofu evenly.
Add cooked rice noodles to the skillet and toss everything together.
Add chopped peanuts and green onions. Stir-fry for another minute.
Remove from heat and garnish with bean sprouts and lime wedges.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
ingredients: Potato filling (boiled and mashed potatoes with spices)
Coconut chutney and sambar for serving
instructions: Rinse rice, urad dal, poha, and fenugreek seeds together and soak them in water for at least 4-5 hours.
Drain the soaked ingredients and grind them into a smooth batter by adding water gradually.
Add salt to the batter and mix well. Let it ferment overnight or for about 8 hours.
Heat a non-stick or cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
Pour a ladleful of batter onto the center of the skillet and spread it in a circular motion to make a thin dosa.
Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa and cook until the bottom turns golden brown and crispy.
Flip the dosa and cook the other side for a minute.
Remove the dosa from the skillet and place a portion of potato filling in the center.
Fold the dosa to form a cylindrical shape or a triangle.
Repeat the process with the remaining batter and filling.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.title: Arabian
recipes.name: Shawarma
ingredients: Chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions for topping
instructions: In a bowl, mix together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, ground cumin, ground paprika, ground coriander, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
Add the chicken or beef to the marinade and coat well. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best flavor.
Heat a grill or skillet over medium heat.
Cook the marinated meat for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until fully cooked and charred.
Remove the meat from the heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
Slice the cooked meat into thin strips.
Warm the pita bread in the oven or on a stovetop.
Spread tahini sauce on the warmed pita bread.
Fill the pita with the sliced meat and top with chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions.
Roll up the pita bread and serve hot.

recipes.name: Mandi Rice
ingredients: 1 pound chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
Toasted almonds and raisins for garnish
instructions: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes. Drain well.
In a large pot, heat ghee or clarified butter over medium heat.
Add sliced onion and minced garlic. Sauté until they are softened and lightly browned.
Add the chicken or lamb pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Stir in ground cumin, ground coriander, ground cardamom, ground turmeric, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot. Stir to coat the rice with the spices and meat.
Pour chicken or vegetable broth into the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
Garnish with toasted almonds and raisins.
Serve hot as a main dish.

recipes.name: Kabsa
ingredients: 1 pound chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
Toasted almonds and raisins for garnish
instructions: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes. Drain well.
In a large pot, heat ghee or clarified butter over medium heat.
Add sliced onion and minced garlic. Sauté until they are softened and lightly browned.
Add the chicken or lamb pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Stir in chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, ground cardamom, cinnamon stick, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot. Stir to coat the rice with the spices and meat.
Pour chicken or vegetable broth into the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
Garnish with toasted almonds and raisins.
Serve hot as a main dish.

recipes.name: Moutabal
ingredients: Pita bread or vegetables for serving
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the eggplants on a baking sheet and pierce them with a fork in a few places.
Roast the eggplants in the preheated oven for about 40-45 minutes, or until the skins are charred and the flesh is tender.
Remove the eggplants from the oven and let them cool slightly.
Peel off the charred skin and discard it.
Place the eggplant flesh in a bowl and mash it with a fork or blend it in a food processor until smooth.
Add tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper to the mashed eggplant. Mix well.
Adjust the seasoning if needed.
Transfer the moutabal to a serving dish and garnish with chopped parsley.
Serve at room temperature with pita bread or vegetables for dipping.

recipes.name: Samak Meshwi
ingredients: 2 pounds whole fish (such as red snapper or sea bass), cleaned
instructions: In a bowl, mix together olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
Make a few diagonal cuts on both sides of the fish.
Rub the marinade all over the fish, including the cuts.
Cover the fish and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Place the marinated fish on the grill and cook for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until the fish is cooked through and has grill marks.
Remove the fish from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve hot with lemon wedges.

recipes.title: African
recipes.name: Jollof Rice
ingredients: 1 pound chicken or beef, cut into pieces
instructions: Wash the rice thoroughly and drain well.
In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion, minced garlic, chopped red bell pepper, and chopped green bell pepper. Sauté until they are softened.
Add the chicken or beef pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Add the washed and drained rice to the pot. Stir to coat the rice with the spices and meat.
Pour chicken or vegetable broth into the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
While the rice is cooking, heat vegetable oil in a separate pan or skillet.
Fry the chicken or beef pieces until they are crispy and fully cooked.
Remove the cooked rice from heat and fluff it with a fork.
Serve the jollof rice hot, garnished with fried chicken or beef pieces and fresh parsley.

recipes.name: Bobotie
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Soak the bread slices in milk until they are soft.

In a large bowl, combine ground beef, finely chopped onion, minced garlic, curry powder, apricot jam, vinegar, chutney, raisins, slivered almonds, and the soaked bread slices (squeezed to remove excess milk). Mix well.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add the beef mixture to the skillet and cook until the meat is browned.
Transfer the cooked beef mixture to a baking dish and spread it evenly.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and mix them with the remaining milk.
Pour the egg and milk mixture over the beef in the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until the top is golden and the dish is set.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.
Serve the bobotie warm with rice, chutney, and garnish as desired.

recipes.name: Doro Wat
instructions: In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until they are softened and lightly browned.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Stir in berbere spice blend, paprika, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Pour chicken broth into the pot. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and cook for about 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Stir in tomato paste and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Add the hard-boiled eggs to the pot and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve the doro wat hot with injera (Ethiopian flatbread) or rice.

recipes.name: Bunny Chow
instructions: In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until they are softened and lightly browned.
Stir in curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and ground ginger. Mix well.
Add the chicken or lamb curry to the pot and cook until it is heated through.
Pour diced tomatoes and chicken or vegetable broth into the pot. Stir to combine.
Simmer the curry mixture for about 15-20 minutes, or until the flavors meld together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Scoop out the centers of the bread rolls, creating a hollow space for the curry.
Fill each bread roll with the prepared curry, making sure to include meat and sauce.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve the bunny chow hot as a flavorful and filling street food.

recipes.name: Ndole
instructions: In a pot, cook the beef or fish until tender. Drain and set aside.
In a separate pot, blanch the bitter leaves to reduce bitterness. Drain and set aside.
In a large pan, heat palm oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until they are softened.
Add the cooked beef or fish to the pan. Stir to combine.
Stir in ground crayfish, groundnut paste, ground cayenne pepper, ground dried shrimp, bouillon powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Gently fold in the blanched bitter leaves, taking care not to overcook them.
Simmer the mixture for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving.
Serve the ndolé hot with plantains or rice.

recipes.title: Indian
recipes.name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: Ghee or vegetable oil for cooking
instructions: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes. Drain well.
In a large pot, heat ghee or vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add sliced onions and sauté until they are golden brown and caramelized. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot and sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they are softened.
Stir in biryani masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned.
In a separate bowl, whisk plain yogurt with chopped cilantro and mint leaves. Add the yogurt mixture to the pot.
Season with salt to taste.
Pour enough water into the pot to cook the rice. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot. Stir gently to combine.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
Garnish with the reserved fried onions, raisins, and cashews.
Serve the chicken biryani hot as a flavorful and aromatic rice dish.

recipes.name: Fish Curry
ingredients: 1 pound fish fillets (such as tilapia or salmon)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or skillet over medium heat.
Add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Sauté until they start to splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and minced garlic to the pan. Sauté until the onions are translucent.
Add ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes are softened.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground cumin, and ground coriander. Mix well.
Add the fish fillets to the pan and gently coat them with the spice mixture.
Pour coconut milk into the pan. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Cover the pan and cook for about 10-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily.
Garnish with curry leaves and chopped cilantro.
Serve the fish curry hot with steamed rice and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Chicken Chettinad
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or skillet over medium heat.
Add mustard seeds and fennel seeds. Sauté until they start to splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and minced garlic to the pan. Sauté until the onions are translucent.
Add ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes to the pan. Cook until the tomatoes are softened.
Stir in Chettinad masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground cumin, and ground coriander. Mix well.
Add the chicken pieces to the pan and coat them with the spice mixture.
Pour coconut milk into the pan. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Cover the pan and cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Garnish with curry leaves and chopped cilantro.
Serve the chicken Chettinad hot with rice, roti, or dosa.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Biryani
ingredients: 1 pound chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
Ghee or vegetable oil for cooking
Saffron strands soaked in milk for garnish
Fried cashews and raisins for garnish
instructions: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes. Drain well.
In a large pot, heat ghee or vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add sliced onions and sauté until they are golden brown and caramelized. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot and sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they are softened.
Stir in biryani masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add the chicken or lamb pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned.
In a separate bowl, whisk plain yogurt with chopped mint leaves, cilantro, and fried onions. Add the yogurt mixture to the pot.
Season with salt to taste.
Pour enough water into the pot to cook the rice. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot. Stir gently to combine.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
Garnish with saffron strands soaked in milk, fried cashews, and raisins.
Serve the Hyderabadi biryani hot as a fragrant and flavorful rice dish.

recipes.name: Meen Varuval
ingredients: 1 pound fish fillets (such as pomfret or tilapia)
instructions: In a bowl, combine lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, fennel seeds, black peppercorns, and salt to make a marinade.
Coat the fish fillets with the marinade. Let them marinate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
In a shallow dish, spread rice flour.
Coat the marinated fish fillets with rice flour on both sides.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan or skillet over medium heat.
Fry the fish fillets in hot oil until they are golden brown and crispy, turning once.
Remove the fried fish from the oil and drain on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
Serve the meen varuval hot with lemon wedges for squeezing.
